short_description: Discover Botswana, a landlocked African nation renowned for its incredible wildlife and pristine wilderness. Experience the magnificent Okavango Delta, witness the Big Five on safari, explore the Kalahari Desert, and immerse yourself in the rich culture of this stable democracy.

health.tap_water_safety: Generally safe in major cities, bottled water recommended
alcohol_info: It is prohibited to sell, serve, or offer alcohol beverages to anyone under the age of 18
Alcohol can be purchased from licensed venues, restaurants, and stores

tipping.hotels: Small tips for porters and housekeeping are appreciated
tipping.guides: 10-15% tip is appreciated for safari guides and tour guides
tipping.restaurants: 10% tip is customary for good service, though not always expected
tipping.taxis: Rounding up the fare is common

weather.title: Botswana has a semi-arid climate with hot, dry winters and warm, wet summers. The country experiences distinct dry and wet seasons, with the dry season from May to October and the wet season from November to April.

when_to_visit.title: Dry Season
when_to_visit.short_description: Cool and dry weather, making this the best time for wildlife viewing. Animals gather around water sources, making them easier to spot. Perfect for safari adventures in the Okavango Delta and national parks. Clear skies and ideal conditions

when_to_visit.title: Wet Season
when_to_visit.short_description: Warm temperatures with frequent rain showers. Lush green landscapes and excellent bird watching. The Okavango Delta floods during this time, creating unique water-based safari experiences. Fewer tourists and lower prices

when_to_visit.title: Peak Wildlife Viewing
when_to_visit.short_description: The absolute best time for wildlife viewing. Cool, dry weather and animals concentrated around water sources. Perfect for spotting the Big Five and other wildlife. Peak season with higher prices but excellent game viewing

weather.best_time: The best time to visit Botswana is during the dry season from May to October when the weather is cool and dry, making it ideal for wildlife viewing and safari adventures in the Okavango Delta and national parks
